description:
I installed Ubuntu 18.04 without problems on a i386 machine (Intel Core 2 Duo processor P7450). In the Software menu Home Assistant is presented as installable. But when I try to install it the process stops during Launch. In the snap menu I see a lot of red lines, but I cannot read them nor copy them because the process goes on and on until it stalls. The snap menu stays on the screen but I cannot copy any text. 
One of the red lines I could read more or less, said: 'Errno 98' and that it couldn install server at port 8123. Also it mentioned that '0.0.0.0' already was in use.
Why is a component presented as installable when in fact it is not?

Doesn't work for me

Says it installed on Mint... but doesn't show up anywhere and I cant find it or get it to run

All this programs seems to do is open a terminal window and throw out red error messages such as:

2020-05-26 15:29:53 ERROR (Recorder) [homeassistant.components.recorder] Error during connection setup: (sqlite3.OperationalError) unable to open database file (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/e3q8) (retrying in 3 seconds)

This is just one of many errors that appear in the terminal window. I think that this app is pretty pointless - I was expecting a GUI to launch


2020-05-26 15:29:53 ERROR (Recorder) [homeassistant.components.recorder] Error during connection setup: (sqlite3.OperationalError) unable to open database file (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/e3q8) (retrying in 3 seconds)
summary: Standard Ubuntu software - Won't open and buggy as hell

description: Good and free app to control home automatisms
summary: Good and free app to control home automatisms
